data.title: Came down to visit family,stopped in for the best coffee and service
data.text: Awesome place to just sit and relax and have a cup of MOJO and a bite to eat, the service was great, our server Kayla was very friendly and fast service. Will definitely  recommend going there.

data.title: Superb breakfast !!!
data.text:
We came into this coffee shop after researching breakfast places on Trip Advisor-they make delicious breakfast sandwiches on Portuguese sweet breads -we added avocado and spinach/their coffees iced or hot are very smooth ! 
They also make sandwiches and salads and variety of specialty drinks. Several small tables and 2 leather chairs! Very pleasant staff! Lots of nearby workers frequent the place. A great find!!

data.title: Awesome coffee and baked goods
data.text: Great little coffee shop. Excellent service. The coffee is fresh and delicious, and the muffins are the best I've ever tasted. I will go out of my way to pick up coffee here instead of the chain place. Love it!

data.title: Pink bean
data.text:
Friendly staff, good food, good beverages!  Hidden gem.  
Tried both the Hott mess and the pilgrim recently and they were both so yummy!

data.title: Best in Fall River
data.text: If you love a good cup of coffee, friendly people and an artsy/eclectic atmosphere, Pink Bean is the place to go!

data.title: Hidden Gem
data.text:
This small coffee shop situated in an otherwise nondescript part of Fall River is like finding $50 in an old coat: a wonderfully unexpected surprise that you selfishly want to keep to yourself.

Serving up perfectly made cups of coffee, espresso, capuccino, Americano, and more, this organically-focused, Bohemian-dressed, funky venue is a terrific place to relax and enjoy while sipping the ideal cup. The world desperately needs more places like this.

But don't let the name fool you, as their sandwiches are just as ridiculously good. We enjoy The Hipster (hummus, spinach, and avocado on a soft bolo). I laughed when my wife suggested that I try it, but now I steal hers once mine is gone. The Pilgrim (Thanksgiving sandwich) and Rock Star (grilled banana & peanut butter w/honey) are similarly fantastic.

Food prep times are a little lenghty, but well worth the wait. Street parking is available, but be sure to feed the meters.

data.title: Great addition to the Fall River area
data.text: It is always welcome to have an alternative to the usual coffee chains. The staff hear is always friendly, welcoming and happy to answer any questions (i.e. "I desperately need caffeine - should I have a latte or a Mojo?"). Their menu is diverse but not so overloaded that they can't keep track of what they offer or so that the quality becomes diminished. I have never eaten here, but it all sounds delicious!

data.title: this place is amazing
data.text: awesome, fresh, and healthy food.  coffee is amazing and the atomsphere is cozy.  staff is super friendly and helpful.

data.title: GREAT!! GREAT!!! GREAT!!
data.text: This place is great!!! They have all natural drinks and will literally create whatever you want and place it on the board in the back so that anyone can order it, i.e. the ogscotty!!! I love this place and frequent it close to once or twice per week!!

data.title: Fabulous Little Coffee Shop
data.text: Found myself jonesing for a good cup of coffee in Fall River and heard about Pink Bean through another travel site and decided to check it out. Sweet little spot, but look for the pink awning. The signage is not great and I drove right by it. Inside is pretty sparse, but homey. I had a latte which was good and the servers were a delight.

data.title: Oasis in the Land of Dunkin Donuts
data.text: After living in Oregon for years I'd forgotten what a stranglehold Dunkin Donuts has in New England, and thus was tickled to find this little cafe tucked on a side street near downtown Fall River. The two women working the place were very nice and happy to chat or not. The wifi was good, the latte was good, the cinnamon apple muffin was good. Put it all together and it rates a very good.
